description: USE OF THE PROPERTY AS A HOUSE WITH ALTERATIONS AND EXTENSIONS: A TWO-STOREY SIDE EXTENSION TO PROVIDE GARAGING, A SWIMMING POOL, TWO ONE BED UNITS AND THREE BEDSIT UNITS TOGETHER WITH A SINGLE-STOREY REAR EXTENSION WITH TERRACE ABOVE AND THREE NEW DORMER WINDOWS TO THE FRONT ROOF SLOPE IN REPLACEMENT OF EXISTING FRONT DORMER.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The developments to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of 5 years, beginning with the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The facing materials used in the development hereby permitted shall match the original facing materials of the existing buildings in type, colour, dimensions and in the case of brickwork, bond, coursing and pointing.

Condition : 3 - No structure including plant, water tanks, equipment or machinery shall be placed, erected or installed on or above the roof or on external walls of the two storey side extension hereby approved without the prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Details of proposals for the storage and disposal of refuse shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development commences. These facilities shall be provided in full accordance with the approved details before any permitted use starts and permanently maintained thereafter.

Condition : 5 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning General Permitted Development Order 1995 (or any other Order revoking or re-enacting this Order) no windows or other openings shall be formed in the roof or walls of the proposed side extension without the prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 6 - Before the building/extension hereby permitted is first occupied, the windows in the south west side of the roof of the two storey side extension shall be glazed with obscure glass and fixed shut and shall be permanently maintained as such thereafter.

Condition : 7 - The flat roof areas of the pool extension hereby permitted shall not be used as a balcony, roof garden, sitting out area or for any other purpose of a similar nature without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 8 - No demolition or construction work in pursuant of this permission shall be carried out on or before 08.00 hours or after 1800 hours on Mondays to Fridays inclusive, before 0800 hours or after 1300 hours on Saturdays and at no time on Sundays or Bank Holidays.

Condition : 9 - The garages and/or car parking spaces as shown on the approved drawings 0224/11B and 12B shall be provided before commencement of the use of the land or buildings hereby permitted and thereafter shall be kept free from obstruction and shall not be used for purposes other than the parking of a vehicle in conjunction with the development hereby permitted.

Condition : 10 - Details of cycle parking facilities shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development and shall be installed prior to the occupation of buildings hereby approved and permanently maintained thereafter.

Condition : 11 - All plant and machinery shall be enclosed and soundproofed in accordance with a scheme previously submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any insulation, and such sound insulation shall be permanently maintained thereafter.
Condition : 12 - The trees shown on the deposited plan 0224/11B to be retained, shall be retained and maintained to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 13 - No preparatory works, site clearance or other building operations shall commence until a plan, showing the method and means of tree/shrub/hedgerow protection has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 14 - Details of the design and methods of construction of the foundation type to be used within 5 metre radius of the existing trees to be retained near rhe south east elevation of the proposed two storey side extension shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved.

Condition : 15 - A tree planting/landscaping scheme, which should include full details of species, size of plants and spacing shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval and be implemented during the next planting season after the completion of the building operations on site, or within any such longer period as may be agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority. The Council will require a maintenance period of 3 years during which dead, dying or defective trees, shrubs and ground cover must be replaced.
Condition : 16 - No external lighting shall be installed without the prior written approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority.
